characters.name: Dr. Wisecrack
characters.voice_description: Playful yet authoritative; a tone that makes you giggle but also listen.
characters.visual_description: A 2D cartoon man with a stethoscope on his neck, a quirky moustache, and round glasses. He wears a white lab coat with colorful doodles like viruses and shields.

characters.name: Skeptical Sally
characters.voice_description: Sassy and skeptical, full of comedic timing with a sarcastic edge.
characters.visual_description: A 2D cartoon woman wearing a business suit, holding a giant coffee mug and rolling her eyes. She has a messy desk behind her, symbolic of a work-from-home vibe.

scenes.title: Introduction to the Importance of Preventing Coronavirus
scenes.background: A clean, cartoonish hospital room with big posters saying 'Wash Your Hands, You Filthy Animal.' A goofy animated virus with sunglasses dances on one of the posters.

dialogues.dialogue: The world was turned upside down by a tiny, invisible force: the coronavirus.

dialogues.name: Dr. Wisecrack
dialogues.dialogue: You heard it, folks. A microscopic villain ruined vacations, made sweatpants trendy, and turned toilet paper into a rare commodity.

dialogues.name: Skeptical Sally
dialogues.dialogue: Oh please, Doc. Let's not pretend people washed their hands BEFORE the pandemic.

dialogues.name: Dr. Wisecrack
dialogues.dialogue: Touché, Sally. But now, we have no choice. Let me enlighten you with some tips to avoid a handshake with disaster.

scenes.display_text: How to Prevent the Coronavirus: A Sarcastic Guide

scenes.title: Tip 1: Wash Your Hands
scenes.background: A cartoon bathroom sink with soap bars, rubber duckies, and bubbles coming alive to applaud when hands are scrubbed.

dialogues.name: Dr. Wisecrack
dialogues.dialogue: Step one, wash those hands like you're auditioning for a surgeon role in a soap opera.

dialogues.name: Dr. Wisecrack
dialogues.dialogue: And no, Sally. Splashing some water and calling it a day does NOT count. Use soap—yes, the scented, bubbly wonder.

dialogues.name: Skeptical Sally
dialogues.dialogue: Soap? Revolutionary. What's next? Breathing air?

dialogues.name: Dr. Wisecrack
dialogues.dialogue: Exactly! Now scrub those hands for 20 whole seconds. Hum 'Happy Birthday' twice... or question your life choices. Either works.

scenes.display_text: Tip #1: Wash your hands properly for 20 seconds!

scenes.title: Tip 2: Wear a Mask
scenes.background: A supermarket aisle with a cartoonishly large mask on every item: bananas, bottles, even the shopping carts.

dialogues.name: Dr. Wisecrack
dialogues.dialogue: Masks! Not for Halloween, but for those heroic nostrils! Believe it or not, they block viruses too, not just bad breath.

dialogues.name: Skeptical Sally
dialogues.dialogue: What if I wear it as a chin guard? Trendy, right?

dialogues.name: Dr. Wisecrack
dialogues.dialogue: Sure, if your chin is the one doing all the breathing. Cover your nose AND mouth. It's not rocket science, Sally.

dialogues.name: Dr. Wisecrack
dialogues.dialogue: Also, don’t forget! Wash or replace your mask. Nobody wants to breathe through something that smells like last week's sandwich.

scenes.display_text: Tip #2: Wear a proper mask like you mean it!

scenes.title: Final Thoughts: Stay Safe, Stay Sarcastic
scenes.background: A sunny park setting with cartoon people wearing masks, jogging, and maintaining a comical 6-feet distance with exaggerated measuring tapes.

dialogues.name: Skeptical Sally
dialogues.dialogue: So, Doc, to sum it all up: wash hands, wear masks, and avoid crowds... basically, don’t be gross?

dialogues.name: Dr. Wisecrack
dialogues.dialogue: Couldn't have said it better myself, Sally. And don't forget—maintain physical distance. These six feet could save your life!

dialogues.name: Skeptical Sally
dialogues.dialogue: Six feet? If only my annoying neighbor followed that rule BEFORE the pandemic.

dialogues.name: Dr. Wisecrack
dialogues.dialogue: And with that, stay safe, stay sarcastic, and remember: COVID prevention is no joke... but it doesn’t hurt to laugh a little.

scenes.display_text: Final Thoughts: Be Safe & Smile Under Your Mask!
